intro: Kibatalia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf kibatalia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. The botanical features of Kibatalia latifolia make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it grows.
